alert.note: Alert for Maricopa; Pinal (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 23 at 6:31PM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 830 PM MST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of south central and southeast Arizona, including the following counties, in south central Arizona, Maricopa. In southeast Arizona, Pinal. * WHEN...Until 830 PM MST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Rises in small streams and normally dry arroyos. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 631 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Up to 0.5 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Waterman Wash, Quail Wash, Sand Tank Wash, Fourth of July Wash, Vekol Wash, Midway Wash, Yellow Medicine Wash, Rainbow Wash, Tenmile Wash, Loudermilk Wash, Enterprise Canal, Daniels Arroyo, West Prong Waterman Wash, Woolsey Wash, Centennial Wash, Quilotosa Wash, Sauceda Wash, Gila River, Bender Wash and Arlington Canal. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Avondale, Goodyear, Buckeye, Gila Bend, Maricopa, Estrella, Bosque, Gila Bend Auxiliary Field, Cotton Center, Sonoran National Monument, Big Horn, Painted Rock Dam, Freeman, Estrella Sailport, Mobile, Rainbow Valley and Ak-Chin Village. - SR 238, US HWY 347, and I-8 - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
